dialogues.text: Huh? Yeah, me, too.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: I forgot to ask, sir. Where'd you go after you left McGill's?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Uh, home.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Home by one-fifteen would you say?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Roughly. Sure. An almost embarrassed silence until...

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Good seeing you, Dave. Grab a beer sometime?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, Sean, I'd like that. Sean and Whitey start back down the sidewalk. Dave watches them go. Sean waves once over his shoulder and Dave finds himself waving back even though Sean can't see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whitey and Sean exit with coffee.  61.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Starbuck's. You believe this crap? Same as Dunkin' Donuts, except five times the price. As they sip, something else is really bothering them.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You take away money or love or hate as possible motives, you're not left with much.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: If this Marcus thing was random, I mean, shit...

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Tell me about it. But the old lady, Prior, she didn't hear a scream. She heard a gunshot, and before that, a 'hi. Which means either the Marcus girl is pretty goddamn friendly or she knew him.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: But she didn't just stop. She turns into the curb. Not too fast or she would've hopped it. Foot comes off the clutch, she stalls.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: She says hi, guy shoots her.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: She slams her door into him, makes a run for it.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: But what makes her swerve without hitting the brakes?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Something in the road.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Maybe. Look, Marcus girl couldn't have weighed more than one-ten. How hard could she have hit the guy to get a head start into the park?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Either he wasn't back on his heels or, he doesn't weigh so much himself.  62.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Which explains the footprints. Three of hers. None of his.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: It did rain... Brendan Harris couldn't be much more than one-fifty.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: You honestly think that kid has it in him?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Your pal, Dave, though. He's a slim guy.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: How'd we get to him?

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: We're getting to him now.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Whitey, he's just a guy who was in the bar.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: The last place she went, Sean, the last place. There's something wrong about that guy. (beat) Did you see his hand?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Yeah... You seriously want to take a look at Dave Boyle?

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Just a little one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy gets out of his car, walks around and pops the trunk. He pulls out a dress wrapped in plastic film. As he heads for the entrance...  63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the "SONS" sits across the desk from Jimmy. The dress is draped over the chair beside him. The Son fills out a form with a gold pen. Jimmy looks far away.

dialogues.speaker: SON
dialogues.text: I'd suggest two sets of visiting hours. From three to five and then seven to nine.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's fine.

dialogues.speaker: SON
dialogues.text: Good. Have you thought about flowers?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I'll call Knopfler's this afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: SON
dialogues.text: Good. And the notice?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: The notice?

dialogues.speaker: SON
dialogues.text: Yes. The obituary. We can take care of it if you'll just give us the basic information. Jimmy reaches out, straightens a fold in the dress.

dialogues.speaker: SON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you'd prefer donations in lieu of flowers, things like that. I can --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (looks over) Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: SON
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: My daughter.

dialogues.speaker: SON
dialogues.text: Um, downstairs. In the basement.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I'd like to see her.  64. The Son blinks back at Jimmy, looks a little unnerved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lying on a stainless steel table, a sheet pulled up under her chin. Her hair clean and combed, her face dusted with makeup. Eyes closed, but no longer clenched tight. The Son stands in the doorway, shifting nervously as Jimmy steps up, stands over his daughter. Jimmy gets down on his haunches, his eyes even with Katie's face. He rests his chin on his forearm, looks at his daughter a long moment. Finally, softly, gently:

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I'm going to kill him, Katie. I'm going to find him before the police do and I'm going to kill him.

dialogues.speaker: SON
dialogues.text: Did you say something, Mr. Marcus? Jimmy answers without looking back.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: The notice. It should read: ‘Katherine Marcus, beloved daughter of James and Marita, deceased, stepdaughter of Annabeth, and sister to Sara and Nadine. As the gold pen flies in the Son's hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whitey and Sean get out of their car. At the same moment, Dave is exiting. He stops short, forces a smile.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: You guys again? Whitey's smile isn't as forced.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: We're like two bad pennies.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: You dropping in on Jimmy?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Yeah.  65.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Did you have some kind of, what, break in the case?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Just paying our respects. Where you off to?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Annabeth got a craving for cigarettes. I'm going to get some. See you in a minute. As Dave moves past them, Whitey does his best Columbo.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: What happened to your hand, by the way? Dave stops short, manages a twisted grin. ANGLE TO INCLUDE SECOND FLOOR WINDOW Celeste looking down on them, listening.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Huh? Oh, garbage disposal. It was jammed and I stuck my hand down there. Then it started up again. Stupid, huh?

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Painful.

dialogues.speaker: PORCH
dialogues.text: Dave nods, continues on his way. Whitey and Sean watch him.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Garbage disposal. Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, it doesn't mean he killed anybody either. Come on. As they start up the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: Her breath starts to come in heaves. She looks like a bird in a cage.  66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Annabeth answers the door to reveal Sean and Whitey. Sean holds out a cigarette, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Heard you could use one.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: (takes it) Thanks. Sean scrapes his lighter to life. As she leans in:

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I quit ten years ago. You believe this?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Hey, whatever you need right now.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: Yeah... come in, I'll get Jimmy. As they start down the hall, Celeste is headed out the other way. In a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: Got a couple errands I gotta run. Be back in an hour or so.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: You don't have to come back, Celeste. I'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Celeste Boyle?

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Sean Devine. I'm a friend of Dave's. From way back. He sticks out his hand. She shakes it reluctantly.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you. Well, I gotta go.  67. She squeezes past down the hall, headed for the door.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: Bye-bye.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: Bye. And she's out the door. As Annabeth continues forward.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Damnit.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: What? A look passes between them.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Better go get it. As Sean heads off after Celeste...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Celeste steps out, Sean is right behind her.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Celeste... She looks back in pure terror.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Could I ask you a quick question?

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: What time did Dave come home on Saturday night?

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: (smiles) It's a little thing. We need to run timelines on anything involving Katie. I'm sure Dave told you he saw her at McGill's on Saturday night.  68.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: You think Dave killed Katie?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: I didn't say that, Celeste. Hell, why would I even think it? Celeste tries to laugh it off.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: We could figure what time she was on the road if we knew what time Dave got home. That's all. It's five minutes from McGill's to your place, Katie left fifteen minutes before Dave did. See what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: I was asleep.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: Saturday night, when Dave got home. I was asleep.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Oh... Well, thanks anyway. As she hurries off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looking as hard as we've seen him look.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Bullshit. He's sitting at the kitchen table with Annabeth and across from Sean and Whitey.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: No. He was dating Katie, Jim. They were going to elope to Las Vegas. We found reservations under their names with United.  69.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Brendan Harris confirmed it. Jimmy shakes his head, trying to understand.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: Remember what you said? How she looked at you for a few seconds on Saturday? Like she was preparing to never see you again? Jimmy drills Sean with a look.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Did Brendan Harris kill my daughter?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: You're a hundred percent positive?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: He passed a poly with flying colors. Plus, he seemed, to me, like he really loved her.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Fuck...

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Jimmy, I'm just curious, man. Why are you so dead set against the kid? He said Katie told him you'd disown her if she ever dated a Harris.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I knew his father. They called him ‘Just Ray.'

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Why's that?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: There were so many guys named Ray in the neighborhood. Crazy Ray Bucheck, Psycho Ray Dorian. Ray Harris got stuck with Just Ray because all the cool nicknames had been taken. (big sigh) Anyhow, we never got along too good. I flat-out didn't like him. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And then he cut out on his wife when she was pregnant with that mute kidof hers so, I don't know, I figure theapple doesn't fall far from the tree and I don't want Brendan or any other Harris seeing Katie or any other daughter I got. (laughs) I don't believe we're talking about Just Ray Harris.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: How about this, Mr. Marcus. We've been talking to witnesses, canvassing people who might've been in the bars and we've run into more than a few people, who were questioned before us by one or more of the Savage brothers.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: So the Savage brothers are not policemen, Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Some people won't talk to the police.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Just so we're clear, and with all due respect, this is our case.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: How long?

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: How long what?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: How long would you say till you put Katie's killer in jail? I need to know.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Are you bargaining with us?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Bargaining?

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Are you giving us a deadline? (off no answer) We'll speak for Katie, Mr. Marcus. If that's okay?  71.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Find her killer, Sergeant. I'm not standing in your way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean and Whitey head in, both feeling the effects of a long day. We walk and talk them inside.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: About the last thing we need right now are Marcus and the Savage brothers putting the fear of God into the neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Those brothers, man. We grew up terrified of them. Eleven months apart. Like they were running a loose cannon factory. They're interrupted by a LAB TECH.

dialogues.speaker: LAB TECH
dialogues.text: Hey, guys, ballistics are in on the Marcus murder.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Yeah? Got a match?

dialogues.speaker: LAB TECH
dialogues.text: Uh huh. You're gonna fucking love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A split-screen shows the grooves cut into two bullets.

dialogues.speaker: LAB TECH
dialogues.text: It's a perfect match. Gun was a .38 Smith. Part of a lot stolen from a gun dealer in New Hampshire in 1982. The same gun that killed Katherine Marcus was used in a liquor store holdup in '84. Right in Buckingham.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: The Flats?

dialogues.speaker: LAB TECH
dialogues.text: Rome Basin. Place called Looney Liquors. I pulled the file. It was a two-man job. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: LAB TECH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They fired a warning shot into a wall. That's where the bullet got pulled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugly even in moonlight, the sluggish current lapping toward the harbor locks. Celeste sits in her car, parked against the rotted pilings, staring out across the channel at Pen Park beyond. East Bucky rises like a landfill beyond, but Celeste's eyes fall somewhere in-between. On the silhouette of the derelict drive-in movie screen. Celeste's eyes are red. She's been crying. And she looks like she wants to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste isn't the only one who's desolate tonight. Brendan Harris sits on the floor, his back against the wall. He stares at the bulging suitcase stowed just under his bed. He's never going to Las Vegas now. Least not with Katie. Finally, he closes his eyes, drops his chin to his chest and rocks a bit. Something comforting in that. The door opens as Silent Ray enters. Wearing his rollerblades, using his hockey stick as a staff. As he wobbles over and site on the bed, Brendan stands, wipes the tears from his face. Ray "signs" something to his brother. Ray "signs" again. Brendan gets angry.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Mom said that? That I'm better off? Ray "signs" something. Brendan gets in his brother's face.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I loved her. You know what that's like? Huh? Ray recoils, shakes his head. Brendan turns away, ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry...  73. Ray taps on the bedpost so that Brendan will look back over. Then he "signs" a final time.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, you're wrong. I won't feel it again. Not ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feisty LOWELL LOONEY, about 80 years old, points up at a row of half-pint bottles behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: LOWELL
dialogues.text: Right there. Went in through a bottle of Jack and stuck right in that wall there. Sean and Whitey stand across from him.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Scary, huh?

dialogues.speaker: LOWELL
dialogues.text: Scarier than a glass of milk maybe.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: (smiles) Take me through it. So these two guys...

dialogues.speaker: LOWELL
dialogues.text: In rubber masks. Came through there. Lowell points back at a doorway covered by a black curtain.

dialogues.speaker: LOWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's the storeroom. There's another door back there that leads to a loading dock. I always keep it locked so they must've had a key.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: A key? You think it was an inside job?

dialogues.speaker: LOWELL
dialogues.text: Had to be. One of them, at least, worked for me at some point. Only reason they fired that warning round was because they must've known I kept this under the counter. Lowell pulls out a sawed-off shotgun.  74.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: And you told the police that at the time?

dialogues.speaker: LOWELL
dialogues.text: Oh, sure. They went through my employment records. Questioned everyone who used to work for me. Never made an arrest.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: You still have those employment records?

dialogues.speaker: LOWELL
dialogues.text: Somewhere in a box in the back. But I can tell you who did it.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: LOWELL
dialogues.text: Guy I fired about two weeks before. Sonuvabitch came in a few days after the robbery. Had this fucking goddamn grin on his face. And I just knew. But tell a grin to a jury, right?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: You remember his name?

dialogues.speaker: LOWELL
dialogues.text: I look senile to you? Name was Ray Harris. They used to call him Just Ray. Sean and Whitey look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: LOWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You say the same gun was used in another crime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the door opens and Celeste comes home. The TELEVISION THROBS from the other room as she enters...

dialogues.speaker: THE LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Dave's on the couch, drinking beer and watching a movie. He hears Celeste enter the room behind, but doesn't look back.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Where you been?  75.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: Out... What are you watching?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Some vampire movie. Guy just got his head torn off... Where'd you go, Celeste?

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: Was sitting in my car by the channel. I just needed to think, you know?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: So what'd you think about?

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: Oh, you know.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Not really, baby, no.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: Things. The day, Katie being dead, poor Jimmy and Annabeth, those things.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Those things. Know what I was thinking about? Huh? Vampires. Celeste wants to run screaming, but...

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: What about them?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: They're undead, but I think maybe there's something beautiful about it. Maybe one day you wake up and you forget. What it's like to be human. Maybe then it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you talking about, Dave? Dave looks back at her, smiles a dark smile.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Vampires, sweetie. Werewolves.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: You're not making any sense.  76.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: You think I killed Katie, Celeste? That the kind of sense we're making these days?

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: (looks away) I don't -- Where'd you come up with that?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: You've barely looked at me since you found out Katie was dead. In fact, you seem like you're repulsed by me.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: Dave...

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: I don't think anything. I'm confused. Even your friend Sean --

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: He's not my friend. Case you haven't figured that out yet.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: He asked me about you. What time you got home.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: What did you tell him?

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: I said I was asleep.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Good thinking, baby.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: Christ, Dave! Just tell them about the mugger! Please...

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: The mugger. I see how your mind's working. I do. I come home with blood on me the same night Katie's murdered. I must have killed her.  77. Celeste just looks at him. Horrified. And Dave starts to laugh. Laughs hysterically. Celeste is horrified. She opens her mouth to say something, but nothing comes out. Finally, as Dave's laughter starts to trail...

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ha-ha-ha. Ha-ha... Henry.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: What? Henry?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Henry and George, Celeste. I never told anyone before, but those were their names. Isn't that fucking hilarious? At least that's what they called themselves. But they were wolves and Dave, Dave was the boy who escaped from wolves.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I'm talking Henry and George. They took me for a four-day ride. And they buried me in this ratty old cellar with a sleeping bag, and, man, Celeste, did they have their fun. And no one came to help old Dave then. Dave had to pretend to be someone else.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: You mean all those years ago? When you were a boy? (touches him) Dave... Dave jerks away from her touch.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Dave's dead. I don't know who came out of that cellar, but it sure as shit wasn't Dave! (calms ) The thing is, it's like vampires, once it's in you, it stays.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: What stays?  78.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Did you know there were child prostitutes in Rome Basin?

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I can't trust my mind anymore, Celeste. I'm warning you. I can't trust my mind. It's official: Celeste has never been more afraid in her whole life.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm going out. I just need to get my head around it.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: Okay... And then he goes. HOLD ON Celeste. As the front DOOR CLICKS shut, it might as well be a gunshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they pull up across from Sean's car. Another long day by the boards.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: I just think the gun sends us in a different direction.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: I don't see it that way.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: What does Just Ray Harris's gun have to do with Dave Boyle?

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: You know how these things get passed around. Just Ray Harris may have blown town, but his gun never did.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: I say we talk to Brendan Harris again. First thing in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: And I say Dave Boyle. The hand story? Huh? And the wife's definitely scared.  79.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: They're hiding something, but Dave's about as much a killer as I guess Brendan Harris is.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Boyle fits the profile a fucking T. White, mid-30a, marginally employed, sexually abused as a kid. You serious? On paper the guy should be in jail already.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: No, Katie Marcus was not sexually abused. In that equation, sexual emission is part of the deal.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: You were friends when you were kids. You're a fucking liability. Sean takes offense.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: He's not my friend. Turns out you're right? I'll have my cuffs off my hip faster than yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy sits on the front porch, thinking. He looks up at someone walking down the sidewalk. It's Dave.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Hey, Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: You're out late.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: You, too. Jimmy nods. It is what it is. Dave leans against the porch, looks about.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nice night, huh?  The words 80.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I guess... I started sitting out here the last few years. Waiting for Katie to come home, you know? It would get to be midnight and I'd tell Annabeth 'I think I'll go sit on the porch for awhile. Weird thing was, it always seemed to bring her home. sit out there for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I saw her, you know.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Katie. I was at McGill's Saturday night?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: You saw Katie Saturday night?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: (nods ) Never got around to telling you. Jimmy's eager for some final word on his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: You talk to her?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: No. I just nodded hello at one point. Next time I looked up she was gone.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Oh...

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: She looked...happy. Jimmy nods, wipes an unexpected tear from his eye.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Got some more walking to do. Good night.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Yeah...  81. Dave continues on his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incredulity as Sean stares at Whitey.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: You stole his car?

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: (smiling) His car was officially towed.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: From the front of his house?

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Oh no. The car was found abandoned in Rome Basin along the parkway. Lucky for us the parkway's state jurisdiction. Some kids must've jacked it, took it for a joyride. Getting angry, Sean lowers his voice.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Why'd you do it?

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: After I dropped you off last night, I decided to talk to Boyle myself. Put a little fear in him. When I got to the house, I looked in his car, just to see what he had in there. Sean's shaking his head, not really listening until:

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I found blood.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: A bit. Found more in the trunk. A lot more. Type O. Same as Katie Marcus.  82.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. Katie Marcus never got in anyone's trunk. She stalled her car, got chased through the park until she died in the park.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: I think it's enough to ask the man a few questions.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: For what? Your search of the cars's going to get tossed out.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: No. Stolen and abandoned in state jurisdiction. For insurance purposes and in the best interest of the owner --

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: You did a physical search and filed a report.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Bingo. Now do you want to talk to him or should I send him home?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Dave's here?

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Been sitting in the box for an hour. I had two of my ugliest troopers pick him up first thing. Hand slamming down on Plymouth roofs. Fists pounding on bulkheads. Feet on the cellar steps. BANG! BANG!

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATION ROOM
dialogues.text: Dave sits looking hung-over, annoyed and pissed at Sean in particular. Sean leans back by the door. Whitey sits in the other chair across from Dave.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Look, Mr. Boyle, we know you didn't get that swollen hand sticking it down a garbage disposal.  83.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Yeah? How do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Why's your wife acting like she's afraid of you? Huh? She know what really happened to your hand? This is a cooler, tougher Dave than we've seen before.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: How about a Sprite or something?

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Tell us what really happened Saturday night, Mr. Boyle.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I already did.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: You lied.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) Your opinion. Which I guess you're entitled to.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: You think this is funny?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: No I don't. I'm tired, I'm hung-over, and not only was my car stolen, but now you're telling me you won't release it to me.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Tell us how the blood got in your car.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: What blood?

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Let's start with the front seat. Dave finally looks a little rattled. He looks to Sean.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: You think I could get that Sprite, Sean?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Sure.  84. As Sean reaches for the door, Dave smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I get it. You're the good cop. How about a meatball sub while you're at it? Any signs of being rattled are gone. Is Dave playing them? Sean lets go of the doorknob, leans back to where he was.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Ain't your bitch, Dave. Looks like you'll have to wait.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: You're somebody's bitch, though. Aren't you, Sean? There's a crazy leer in Dave's eyes, a preening cockiness.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: The blood on your front seat, Dave. Answer the Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: We got a chain-link fence in our back yard. Me and my kid play Whiffle ball every afternoon after school and he's getting pretty good. Most of the balls are on the other side of the fence. So I climb it. Except I slip on the top and slice myself where the links curl in. (pats his ribs) Right here. Bled like hell. Ten minutes later, I had to pick up Michael. It was probably still bleeding when I got in the seat. Best I can figure.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: And what blood type are you?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: B negative.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY, (SMILES)
dialogues.text: Hey, that's the match we got.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Well, there you go.  85.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Not quite. The blood in the trunk was not B negative.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I don't know anything about any blood in my trunk.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: No idea how a half pint of blood got in your trunk?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: None.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: This is not the way you want to go, Dave.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: How's it going to look in court? You don't know how someone else's blood got in your trunk.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Fine, I suppose. You filed the report.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: What report?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: The stolen car report. Whitey and Sean both get the same sinking feeling.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The car wasn't in my possession last night. Whatever the car thieves used it for, you should find out. Because it sounds like they were up to no good. A long silence. Whitey's fucked. Sean looks at the floor, shakes his head ever so slightly.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Things looking any better on that Sprite?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean and Whitey now on this side. Dave still sitting on the other.  86.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: You got too fucking smart. Car's inadmissible. His lawyer can say anything in it was put there by the car thieves.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: I can break him.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Break him? He just kicked our asses in there.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Yeah. But you still think old buddy Dave wouldn't hurt a fly? A moment as they both think.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: It's the gun, Whitey. We bust this open on that gun.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Maybe. Okay. Sean looks through the two-way at Dave.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: What about Dave?

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Fuck it. Kick him loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy walks down a row of headstones, the SALESMAN a respectful two steps behind.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: Maybe a Celtic cross. That's a popular choice. Jimmy finally stops before one that is simple and white.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: That one.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: Very good. Nice and simple. As the Salesman jots down some info, Val Savage arrives.  87.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Hey, Jimmy. Jimmy turns to see him. They step away from the Salesman.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Been out asking around, like you said to.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Thanks, man. Jimmy taps his fist into Val's. Val taps back.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: It ain't 'cause you did two years for me, Jim. And it ain't 'cause I miss your brain running things, either. Katie was my niece, man.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Maybe not by birth or nothing, but I loved her.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I know, man. What's up?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Cops are all over this. Doing their job for once. They're smothering the bars, street trade, everything. Every hooker I've talked to, every bartender, they've already been questioned. I mean, the law has descended.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: What about just Ray's kid? You find out anything there?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Kid's a mouse by all accounts. No trouble to anyone. Eve and Diane said he loved her, Jim. Said she loved him. Jimmy stews on this a moment.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Want me to take a run at him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, Val. Hold off for the time being. Anything else? Val hesitates, holding something back. Val waits Jimmy's eyes narrow, then he looks out at the cemetery beyond.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: You want to spit something. What is it?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: I heard Sean and his fat-head partner went by Dave Boyle's.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Dave was at McGill's that night. They probably questioned him like everyone else. a beat. That's not it.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: I heard something else. This morning.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Two Staties came by. In uniform.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Probably forgot to ask him something.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: No. They took Dave with them when they left. They put him in the back seat. now what I mean?
Sean and Whitey have a bunch of yellow, old files spread across Sean's desk. Whitey reads from a probation report.  89.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Raymond Matthew Harris. Born nine-six- 1957. 1981 takes a job with the M.B.T.A. First child, Brendan Seamus born in 1983. Same year Just Ray is indicted in a scam to embezzle subway tokens. Charges dropped, but he's fired. Worked odd jobs after that, including clerk at Looney Liquors. Questioned in that robbery, questioned in another, same year; Blanchard Liquors in Middlesex County. Released on lack of evidence.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Beginning to become known though.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: He's getting popular. A known associate, one Edmund Reese, fingers Raymond in the 1985 heist of a rare comic book collection.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Comic books? You go, Raymond.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: A hundred fifty thousand dollars worth of comic books.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Oh, excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Raymond returns said literature unharmed. Does a year solid inside. Comes out of prison with a wee chemical dependency problem.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: But gets honest work to support the habit, right?

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Apparently not. Picked up by a joint Major Crime Unit/F.B.I. sting for trafficking stolen goods across state lines. Stole a truckload of cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Our boy's got style.  90.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: He's got a boatload of grief, too. Stole the truck in Rhode Island, drove it into Massachusetts.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Hence the federal interstate rap.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Hence, they got him by the balls. (flips page) But he does no time. Not a day.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: He rolled on someone.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Looks that way. After that, nothing. He's clean. Until August 1989. Poof, he disappears. They consider it all a beat.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: One, he's dead. Two, he's in Witness Protection.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Three, he went deep underground then just popped back in the neighborhood to kill his son's 19-year-old girlfriend. I mean, come on. We got nothing.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: We got a guy who was a prime suspect in a robbery eighteen years ago during which the murder weapon was used. Guy's son dated the victim. I'd say we got a lot. Whitey flips through the file. Sean realizes something.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anything in there about Just Ray's known associates? Whitey flips, looks, finds it.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Known criminal associates. Reginald 'Dukie' Neil, Kevin 'Whackjob' Sirraci, Nicholas Savage, hmmm, Anthony Waxman. Whitey suddenly looks up. And Sean knows it's here.  91.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And one James Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: And the hits just keep coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean and Whitey look up as 58-year-old AGENT BURDEN enters.

dialogues.speaker: BURDEN
dialogues.text: You guys looking for me?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: I'm Sean Devine, this is Whitey Powers. They all shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: BURDEN
dialogues.text: What's up? I already got to get back.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: You worked a task force with Major Crimes in the '80s.

dialogues.speaker: BURDEN
dialogues.text: A bunch of them.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: You took down a small-timer. Ray Harris. Stole a truck full of cigarettes from a rest stop in Cranston, Rhode Island.

dialogues.speaker: BURDEN
dialogues.text: Trucker went to take a piss. The Harris guy jacked the truck. I think we pulled him over in New Bedford.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: But Harris walked.

dialogues.speaker: BURDEN
dialogues.text: He didn't walk. He rolled. Boston Police's Anti-Gang Unit stepped in to get info on another case. He rolled for them.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: On who?  92.

dialogues.speaker: BURDEN
dialogues.text: What the fuck was the name? (tries to remember ) Him and three other guys knocked off the M.B.T.A. counting room. Sixty grand... Jimmy Marcus. Kid was like nineteen or twenty. Slick as hell, man. Ran a crew, never got arrested.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Did Ray Harris testify in open court?

dialogues.speaker: BURDEN
dialogues.text: Never made it to court. Marcus dummied up on who he'd been working with. D.A. was afraid he might not be able to convict. So he cut a deal for two years inside, couple more suspended.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: So Jimmy Marcus never knew Ray Harris ratted him out? Burden looks at the two of them a beat, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BURDEN
dialogues.text: Ray Harris vanished from the face of the earth two months after Marcus rotated back into the free world. What does that tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste. Pacing the sidewalk up from Jimmy's house. She stops, watches as Val's car pulls up and he and Jimmy get out. As they near the front steps, she hurries forward.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: Hey, Jimmy! Val!

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Hey, cuz. She looks nervous as hell. Val and Jimmy exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: Jimmy, could I talk to you a sec?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Sure. (to Val) Catch up with you in a minute.  93. Celeste manages a smile back as Val disappears inside.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here. Step into my office. Jimmy sits on the porch steps. She sits beside him. Jimmy watches her a moment, waiting. But she's all bottled up.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Beautiful day, huh? That's almost enough to send her over. Her lip trembles. She turns her head away to wipe a tear.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whatever it is, Celeste. It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: I took Michael and spent last night at a motel.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: I don't know, Jim. I may have left Dave for good.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (monotone) You left Dave.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, he's been acting nuts lately. I'm, I'm almost afraid of him. She looks at Jimmy, sees a knowledge in him.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (trembling) Do you know something?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I know he was taken by the cops this morning. I know he saw Katie the night she died, but didn't tell me till after the police had questioned him about it. I know his hand looks like he's been punching a wall with it. (beat) Anything else I should know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: At three in the morning on Sunday, Dave came back to our apartment covered in someone's else's blood. Those words kill the noise along the avenue, stop the breeze. Right now they're the only two people on Earth.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: What did he say happened?

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: That he was mugged. That he bashed the mugger's head on the street. That he might've killed him. But there was nothing in the paper. Tears start to run down her face. She presses her forehead to Jimmy's chest. Finally, gently, Jimmy pushes her back. So he can look in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Celeste.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Do you think Dave killed Katie? Celeste looks about. Finally, unable to verbally form the damning response, she finally just nods her head. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan sits across from Sean and Whitey. He looks confused, tired and scared.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Tell me about your father, Brendan.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Your father. Raymond Senior. You remember him.  95.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: So you don't remember the guy?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: I remember little things. He smelled like Schlitz and Dentyne. He... A small smile slides softly across Brendan's face.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: He what, Brendan?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Carried a lot of change in his pockets. It jingled when he walked. You could hear him when he came home. And if I could guess how much he had, if I was even close, he'd give it to me.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: What about a gun? You remember your father having a gun?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: What? No.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: You seem awful sure for someone who was only six when he left. A DETECTIVE comes in, sets a cardboard box on Sean's desk.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: What you asked for. C.S.S. reports, ballistics, fingerprint analysis, the 911 tape, a bunch of stuff.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Thanks. As he moves off...

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: We were talking about your father’s gun.  96.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: I told you, my father didn't have a gun.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: I guess we were misinformed. You talk to your father much?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Never. Said he was going out for a drink and he never came back. Brendan looks like he's in pain.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Your mother never filed a missing persons report. How came?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Because he isn't missing. He sends money every month. Sean and Whitey exchange a surprised look.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: He sends money?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Five hundred dollars, every month. Like clockwork.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: From where?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Postmark says Brooklyn. Whitey picks up a pad of paper, starts to scribble.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: How do you know it's him?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Who else would send it? My mom says that's how he was. Do something shitty then try to make up for it. Whitey hands Sean the pad. It’s years times months times $500. The underlined answer is $80,000.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why you asking me if my father had a gun?  97.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: You know why, kid.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: No, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: The gun that killed your girlfriend was the same gun your father used in a robbery eighteen years ago. Something dark starts working through Brendan's brain. Some new and sudden knowledge. Sean sees it.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You want to tell me about it?

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: My father didn't have a gun. Sean slaps the desktop, jerking Whitey to attention.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: You are fucking lying! But Brendan doesn't react. He's gone somewhere else. Somewhere grim and hard.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Can I go now? Or are you gonna charge me with Katie's murder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: walking down Crescent Avenue. A car pulls alongside... FLASHBACK -— PLYMOUTH Pulling up across from Young Dave before he can finish writing his name in the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Val Savage at the wheel. Dave's new best friend.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Dandy Dave Boyle, how they hanging, brother? Dave squats down to see Val eye-to-eye.  98.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Hey, Val? What're you up to?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: I'm starving. Was looking for someone to grab a bite to eat with, maybe a beer?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: What do you say? How about a boy's night out in the middle of the day? We'll hit a place I know across town.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I'll have to get home at some point.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Don't we all. Come on, hop in.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: (smiles) First round's mine.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Now you're talking! And for the second time in his life, Dave gets inside a CAR he shouldn't. As Val GUNS IT away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brendan's gone. Sean and Whitey are bleary, having huffed and puffed through the contents of the cardboard box.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: The kid was lying about the gun. Don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Absolutely. Told you three times already. What about the father? What do you think about him?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: I think, just possibly now, that Just Ray is still alive.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Eighty grand. Who's going to send that if it's not the father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean sticks his head in his hands, groans in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go home. Have a drink. Let it go for awhile.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. Sean looks into the box. All that's left is a cassette tape. He pulls it out.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anything good on the 9-1-1 call?

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Thought you listened to it. Sean sighs, sticks the tape into a player on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: 9-1-1, police services. What is the nature of your emergency?

dialogues.speaker: BOY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There's like this car with blood in it and, ah, the door's open --

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What's the location of the car?

dialogues.speaker: BOY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Uh, Sydney Street in the Flats. By Pen Park. Me and my friend found it.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Son, what's your name?

dialogues.speaker: BOY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (to someone else) He wants to know her name.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Your name. What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: BOY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We're so fucking out of here. Good luck. The connection breaks. Sean turns off the tape machine.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Well, that breaks the case wide open.  100.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Let's at least get a burger. Sean nods. Standing, he grabs his Glock and holster out of his top drawer. They start out; Sean freezes.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Her.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: The kid on the tape. Sean hits rewind, play.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Son, what's your name?

dialogues.speaker: BOY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He wants to know her name.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: He said, ‘her name.'

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Right. Dead girl, you refer to her as a she.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: But how does the kid know that? She'd dead in the park. How does he know the blood in the car came from a woman.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Play it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dive backed up against the river. A few old-timers, a few pool tables. Dave and Val sit in a booth. There are four empty shot glasses and a nearly empty pitcher of beer.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: This one time back in the day, right? We take off this stamp collector. Rob him, tie him up and go. Me, my brother Nick and this kid Carson Leverett who couldn't tie his own fucking shoes if you didn't show him.  101. Dave laughs; this is really funny.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So we're coming down the elevator and we're wearing suits so we fit in. And this old lady gets on and starts freaking out. So I turn to Nick and he's looking at Carson because the fucking bonehead's still got his Ronald Reagan mask on.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: And you guys didn't notice?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Little shit like that happened on jobs all the time. That's why Jimmy was so missed. He saw the whole field, man.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Why do you think be went straight?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: One word pure and simple... Katie.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: I like the night too much. Day's just something you sleep through. Another shot?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I should slow down. Till we eat.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Come on, don't go pussy on me. Before Dave can answer, Val is on his way to the bar. A passing headlight flashes white in Dave's face. As he blinks, a silhouette comes through the door. As the door shuts and Dave's vision clears, he realizes it's Jimmy. Jimmy nods at Dave and then goes to Val at the bar. Says something in his ear. Val looks back at Dave and nods. The two of them head over carrying three shots and a bottle. Jimmy sits in across from Dave while Val slides next to him.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: How's it going?  102.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I'm a little drunk. You gain some weight? You look bigger. Jimmy smiles, passes out the shots.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: To our children. They down the shots. Jimmy immediately pours another round.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: I always liked this bar.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Yeah. No one bothers you.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: That's important. No one bothering you in this life. No one fucking with you or your loved ones. Right, Dave?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Absolutely. It's the funniest thing Val ever heard.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: This guy's a hoot. He can get you going. Jimmy smiles at Dave, but it's pure frost.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. My man, Dave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seething purpose, Brendan enters, pulls a kitchen chair over to the butler's pantry. Standing on the chair, he looks up a beat at the slatted ceiling. He reaches up and presses with his right palm. A section of slats lifts up and away revealing an opening in the ceiling. Brendan looks up a beat, reaches into the black.  103.

dialogues.speaker: HIDING PLACE
dialogues.text: Brendan's hand looks like it's playing an imaginary keyboard as it bounces and gropes in the dust and wood chips for something that is not there. His father's gun.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: As he realizes he's not going to find it.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: No... He returns the slat to its place, steps off the chair. He brings the chair back to the kitchen table and site down on it. Sits down so he's facing the door in the center of the apartment. And as Brendan waits..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave's having trouble focusing. Jimmy and Val seem like they've forgotten he's here.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Remember we took Ray Harris here that one time?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Sure. Good old Ray.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: He was a hoot, too. Most people called him 'Just Ray,' but I called him Ray Jingles. As Dave tries to concentrate, Val leans into him.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This guy, right? He carried like ten bucks in change in his pocket, in case he had to make a phone call to Libya or some fucking place. Val laughs, lights a cigarette. As the smoke climbs up into Dave's face, he looks across at Jimmy who watches him with a flat, determined expression. As Jimmy smiles, Dave swallows, takes a deep suck of air.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: You all right?  104. Dave holds up a hand as it surges up inside him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Oh shit...

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Dave?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I'm going to be sick. A flicker of a look between Val and Jimmy. Val slides out.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Use the back door. Huey don't like cleaning it off toilet rims. Val grips Dave's shoulders, turns him and heads him off for a door at the far end of the bar.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR
dialogues.text: As Dave pushes through...

dialogues.speaker: DOOR
dialogues.text: Bursting open. But, we're in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Silent Ray is arriving home with John O'Shea in tow. Brendan watches from the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Hey, Ray. Come in here a second. Ray comes in. John stops in the doorway holding a duffel bag. Brendan pulls a second chair out with his foot.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sit down, Ray. Ray catches a vibe, looks a little suspicious, but he sits.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who do you hate?  105. Ray stares back at him.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on, who? Ray "signs" an answer.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No one? Who do you love? Ray looks down at his shoes, then up at Brendan. Finally, he points a finger at his brother.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You love me? (as Ray nods) What about Ma? Ray looks down again, shakes his head. "No."

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. You love me so much, I want to hear you say it. Ray looks back up, confused.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know you can speak. So say you love me. Ray looks back over his shoulder at John.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't look at him, look at me. Now say it, say you love me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out back. One light over the door. And we're TRACKING BACK WITH Dave as he stumbles through the weeds. Drops to his hands and knees at the edge of the Mystic River. We're BACK BEHIND as he heaves, empties his stomach into the dirty water. Finally, he lurches to his feet, wipes his mouth with the back of his hand. He takes a few deep breaths, feels better. And when Dave finally turns around, Jimmy and Val are standing there. One on either side of the door, the light bulb burning between them. Dave grins.  106.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Hey, guys. Come to make sure I didn't fall in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray sitting across from Brendan, freaking out a little at his brother's request.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: Come on, say you love me. Finally Ray stands, holding his middle finger in Brendan's face and then turns to go. Brendan is on him in a flash. He grabs Ray by the hair and jerks him back. Ray flies over the kitchen table, slams into the wall and hits the floor.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You love me so much you kill my fucking girl friend?! Huh? That gets John O'Shea moving. Motoring for the door. But Brendan's all over him. Grabbing him by the scruff of the neck, he bounces him off the door, spins him around.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My brother never does anything without you, O'Shea! Never! Brendan punches him twice in the face, breaking his nose. John hits the floor, curls into a ball spitting blood.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm coming back. He kicks John, heads back for Ray who's just standing. Brendan slaps him so hard he reels into the sink. Brendan grabs him by the shirt. Tears and blood stream down Ray's face. Brendan throws him to the floor. Spreading Ray's arms, Brendan kneels on him.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Speak, you fucking freak or I swear I'll kill you! Speak!  107.

dialogues.speaker: STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: As Sean and Whitey enter. They freeze at:

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Say her name! Katie! Say it or you die! As they start hard up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Ray shakes his head as Brendan looms. There's a LOUD COUGH behind them. Brendan looks over his shoulder to see John O'Shea on his feet, Ray Senior's gun in his hand. Aimed. But as the front door bursts open, John wheels, finds himself pointing the .38 point blank at Sean. Sean's hand is on his Glock, but it's still holstered. He stops short; Whitey filling the door behind him. As Sean blinks down the barrel... Whitey's eyes flicker past to Brendan and Ray.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: Kid, you need to point that gun at the floor. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (re: Sean's gun) That's a Glock, right? Sean nods as time stands still and his life flashes.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (big smile) You wanna draw on me? Come on.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: No. I don't want to hurt a kid. And it looks like someone else beat me to it. John remembers. Looks quite deadly.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Brendan fucking punched me. Broke my nose.

dialogues.speaker: WHITEY
dialogues.text: We'll arrest him for it if you want. Haul his ass to jail.  108.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I don't want him arrested. I want him fucking dead. As the .38 sweeps away back toward Brendan, Sean reaches out, claps a hand over John's wrist. BOOM! The GUN DISCHARGES into the wall as Sean strips it away, knocking John to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Motherfucker. Whitey kneels to cuff John who's now crying like a baby. Sean walks forward toward Brendan. Brendan slides off his brother, just sits on the floor looking up at Sean. Sean shrugs, almost apologetically.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We know.

dialogues.speaker: BRENDAN
dialogues.text: What? What do you know? Sean looks back at John, down at Ray, then back to Brendan. Sean finally shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy puts his arm around Dave's shoulder, leads him along the river. Val walks a few paces behind.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Let me tell you about Ray Harris. He was a buddy of mine. Used to visit me in prison. Used to check up on Marita and Katie and my mother and see if they needed anything. But he also put me in prison. He ratted me off.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Shit. That's terrible.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: My wife had cancer.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I remember, man. I --  They stop. 109.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Ray Harris robbed me of being with her. I know we all die alone, but I could have helped her with the dying. Not the death, but the dying. You see what I'm saying? ‘Dave takes a half step away, faces Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Why are you telling me this? Jimmy points. Far below the Tobin Bridge, at a rotted cluster of pilings, a small boat with an outboard motor tied up.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I made Ray kneel down right over there and I shot him twice. Once in the chest, once in the throat. We were both crying when I did it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Hey, Jimmy, I don't --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Ray begged. Pregnant wife. Little Brendan. Said he knew me. Said I was a good man... How about you, Dave? Do you think I'm a good man?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: What is it you think I did, Jimmy?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: As I sunk Ray in the river, I could feel God watching me. Shaking his head. Not mad, just, I guess the way you'd get when a puppy shits on your rug.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: You think I killed Katie, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Don't talk, Dave. Panic rising, Dave sees Val holds a gun in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: No, no, no. I killed someone, but it wasn't Katie.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Is this the mugger story?  110.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: He wasn't a mugger. He, he was a child molester. He was having sex with this kid in his car. He was a wolf; he was. a vampire.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: The child prostitute we saw Dave try to talk to. Getting into a car with a man. The kid's head disappears below the dash. And then Dave is there. Dave hauls the man from the car, his pants down around his knees as Dave pounds his head on the pavement. The boy jumps out the passenger side, runs away.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Of course, Dave, sure. You killed a child molester.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, me and the boy.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Oh, the molested kid helped you?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: No what? You said you and a boy.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Young Dave running but sounding like an animal.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: No, no, forget that. My head gets fucked up sometimes. I --

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Your wife thinks you killed Katie. And you'd rather have her believe that than, what, you killed a child molester? Most people really don't mind when a child molester dies, Dave. Why didn't you just tell Celeste the truth?  111.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I, I don't know. Maybe I thought I was turning into him. I didn't kill Katie!

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: And I didn't hear of any dead guys being found lately.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I put him in the trunk of my car. Dumped his body in the woods --

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Letting this bag of shit explain, Jim? You kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Shut up, Val... (to Dave) Katie was nineteen. You know? Nineteen and she never did nothing to you. Why'd you kill her?

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: The DRIVER slamming his hand on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Get in!

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Look at me, Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I'm looking, Dave. I'm looking.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: LOOKING DOWN from a second floor window at young Jimmy who site on the curb below. As Dave's mom pulls the blind shut from behind him.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Why'd you do it?  112. FLASHBACK --— CELLAR Feet coming down. Young Dave burying his face in the rags. Young Dave pounding on the bulkhead.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Adult Dave pounding on the molester in the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Me and my son, me and Celeste, there's so many things to make right.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Make them right now. Start now. Admit what you did.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: No more lies, no more secrets, I want to go home to Celeste. I want to feel Celeste.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Good. Right after you do your time. I did mine. Do yours. Admit what you did.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: The boy...

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: One more time about the boy and I will open you up. Jimmy holds a wicked-looking buck knife. Dave dry heaves. Jimmy nearly does himself. Even Val looks confused as Jimmy blinks out toward the river.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought I was done. I thought I had left killing people and dumping them in the river behind. (turns to Dave) Admit what you did and you'll live. Say it out loud and you'll breathe. You'll go to jail, but I will give you your life. Finally, Dave decides it's a way to save his life, maybe even a way to ease Jimmy's grief.  113.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, I did it. Jimmy closes his eyes, lowers the knife. Val can't believe what he's watching.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Why...

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: That night in McGills, she reminded me of a dream I've had.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: What dream?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: A dream of youth. I don't remember having one. And she was the dream of it, and I just snapped. Jimmy opens his eyes again. He's trembling.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: So it was the dream, then?

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: The dream, yeah. You'd know what I mean. If you'd got in that car instead of me.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (hardens ) But I didn't get in the car, Dave. You did. We're CLOSE ON them. And then Dave gets a funny look on his face. A funny face and then he looks down. Looks down in time to see Jimmy's hand pulling the knife back from his guts. Blood gushes down onto Dave's jeans.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Yes! That's what I'm talking about. Dave looks back at Jimmy, who turns, sends the knife sailing into the Mystic. Jimmy looks back over.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: We bury our sins here, Dave. We wash them clean.  114. Dave suddenly drops, finds himself sitting in the tall weeds. Hands trying to hold his guts in. He looks up, watches as Val hands the gun to Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: He's moving his lips. See his fucking lips moving?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I got eyes, Val. Finally, Dave's words come out in a whisper.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: I wasn't ready.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Like I said. You do this part alone. And Jimmy raises the GUN, places the barrel against Dave's forehead. And as Dave closes his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: WHITE SKY
dialogues.text: And we PAN DOWN to find ourselves ON...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where it all began. Jimmy sits on the curb, by the sidewalk where they once wrote their names. Jimmy, Sean and half of Dave. Jimmy sips his bourbon from a pint. A car pulls up across the street. Sean. He walks over.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Annabeth said you might be here. (re: bourbon) Tough night? Jimmy nods.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Me, too. Saw a bullet with my name on it.  115. Jimmy holds up the pint. Sean takes it, swallows a long pull. As he hands it back...

dialogues.speaker: SEAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We got them.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Got who?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Katie's killers. Got them cold. It's trying to get in, but it hasn't sunk yet.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Killers? Plural?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Kids, actually. Ray Harris's son, Ray Junior, and a kid John O'Shea. They confessed a couple hours ago.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: No question?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: None.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: They don't know. They were playing with a gun. Saw a car coming so one of them lies down in the middle of the street. Car swerves, clutch kicks out. Katie. O'Shea says they meant to just scare her, but the gun went off. She hit him with the door and ran. They chased her so she wouldn't tell no one.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: And the beating they gave her?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Ray Junior had a hockey stick. Jimmy looks around. It's sinking now. Sean crouches down beside him.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go easy, Jim. Take a breath. (beat) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SEAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look at me. I got a call from Celeste Boyle. She was hysterical. She said Dave's missing. Said you might know where he is. Jimmy looks at Sean, but can't find any words.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We need to talk to him. Boston police found the body of a guy this morning. In the woods behind McGill's.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: A guy?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: A pedophile with three priors. They want to talk to Dave about it. Jimmy lurches up past Sean. Trying to get a grip.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When was the last time you saw Dave, Jimmy? Finally, standing there in the middle of the street...

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Last time I saw Dave? Dave Boyle?

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, Dave Boyle.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: It was twenty-five years ago. Going down this street in the back of that car.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanks for busting Katie's killers, Sean. Really. Maybe if you'd been a little faster though? It's so goddamn awful. They look at each other a sad beat.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: You going to send Celeste five hundred a month, too? Eyes brimming, Jimmy looks back up the street. Sean does the same. Right where they were when Dave was driven away.  117.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sometimes I think, I think all three of us got in that car. And all this, it's just a dream.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: A dream, sure.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: In reality we're still eleven-year-old boys trapped in a cellar. Imagining what our lives would have been if we'd escaped.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Maybe you're right. Who the fuck knows? Jimmy turns and starts walking down the street. Sean just watches after him. Watches as Jimmy walks down the same street, disappears the same way Dave did. Sean's CELL PHONE RINGS. Finally, he answers.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Hello? No answer. HIGHWAY sounds from the other end. Sean knows who it is, finally knows what to say...

dialogues.speaker: SEAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... I need you to know that. I pushed you away. A long pause.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, too. It's been so messed up. Loving you, hating you.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Come home.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You change the locks or anything? Sean smiles with a sudden sense of surprise and relief.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Everything's just the way you left it.

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Nora.  118.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Nora. That's our daughter's name, Sean.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: Nora... And Sean starts to walk toward his car, still talking on the phone, laughing. And as the SOUND FADES OFF, we HOLD ON the sidewalk, on the names written so long ago.

dialogues.speaker: FOOT TRAFFIC
dialogues.text: On the sidewalk. People lining up. And we TILT UP TO the Buckingham Day Parade. Floats, color guard, politicians in convertibles. Over it all...

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I killed the wrong man. This is what I've done and I can't undo it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Shhh, Jimmy. Shhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annabeth steps up to Jimmy, starts to unbutton his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want to hear your heart. She places an ear to his chest. Jimmy nearly can't breathe under his burden. We hear the PARADE OUTSIDE.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Last night, when I put the girls to bed, I told them how big your heart was.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Annabeth --

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: I told them how much you loved Katie. Because you created her and sometimes your love for her was so big, your heart felt like it was going to explode from loving her.  119.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Please stop.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: I told them their daddy loved them that much, too. That he had four hearts and they were all filled up and aching with a love that meant we would never have to worry. Annabeth pulls off her own shirt, presses herself to him.

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I told them their daddy would do whatever he had to for those he loved. And that is never wrong. That can never be wrong. No Matter what their daddy had to do.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: You knew?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: Celeste called looking for you. Told me about Dave. Told me what she told you. Said she was worried something might happen. She kisses his throat, starts to undo his belt.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Why didn't you call?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: Because they're weak.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Who's weak?

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH
dialogues.text: Everyone. Everyone but us. We will never be weak. And you. You could rule this town. A beat as Jimmy stares at her. And then he kisses her. Hungry for this woman. His woman. Passion builds precipitously. As she returns it, between breaths:

dialogues.speaker: ANNABETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And, Jim? After? Let's take the girls down to the parade. Katie would've liked that.  120. Jimmy lifts her up. She hooks her legs around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It streams along. Sean stands watching with his wife Lauren and his baby daughter. A float passes by filled with children who shout, laugh and wave. All except for one who's lost, sad, haunted. The child's eyes find Sean's for just an instant and then he's gone. Sean snaps from the sudden trance, looks across the street at Jimmy, Annabeth, their daughters and a few of the Savage brothers. Waving at the parade, happy and strong. Suddenly aware of being watched, Jimmy's head swivels. His eyes lock on Sean's. Jimmy gives Sean the smallest smile. And Sean points a "finger gun." Drops his thumb on the imaginary hammer. And as Jimmy's smile widens... FADE TO BLACK.
